lines.text: [Miranda sneaks into Alex's bedroom and into his bed wearing only lingerie, crawling under the sheets with him]

[Alex thinking it's Corinne, invitingly responds]
Hi, darling.

[Miranda whispers]
Shh! Mom's next door.

[Alex sits up turning on the bedroom light]
What are you doing here?
What does it look like I'm doing?
Miranda!
[Alex covers his naked chest with the blanket sheet]
What?

[Alex sounding like a father says]
It's way past your bedtime. Go to your room!
[Corinne tells her psychiatrist Dr. Bailey, about feeling attractive after meeting Alex]
Oh, Dr. Bailey, I don't know if it's just his body I'm attracted to or his soul. Or if it's just me.

[Corinne lays back in the long chair]
Mmm. I'm feeling... Generally... Attractive. The truth is, I'm so ripe, I'm about to fall off the vine.
[Miranda demands an explanation from her mother Corinne, on why Alex has to leave]
He's... Weird.
Mom... Weirdness is not a criminal offense. If it were, you'd be serving a life sentence.
[Philip tells Corinne and Alex the things he believes in to be real]
Now, look, I'm just a dumb newspaper man. I believe Monday follows Sunday. I believe that summer follows spring. I believe in God and glasnost. I believe in things you can touch.
[Corinne tells Philip that her and Louie are having a baby]
Philip.
Hmm?
We're having a baby.

[Philip pauses, whispering to Corinne in front of Louie]
How are we going to break the news to Louie?

[the three laugh together and hug each other]
Philip!
[last lines]
Philip.
Yeah.
There's something I have to tell you.
Now?
I'm in love with Miranda.
I know.
[both men smile, as Alex looks to Miranda walking up the aisle in her bridesmaid dress, and Philip looks to Corinne walking up the aisle in her wedding dress]

[the wedding Officiant begins to speak]
Dearly beloved, we have come together in the presence of God to witness and bless...
[the Limbodrome Staff angel tries to explain to the nervous Louie why he feels funny]
You know, I've been feeling very strange.

[the angel happily chuckles]
What do you expect? Your body's cream sauce all over Wisconsin Avenue.

[the angel happily laughs]
Here it is. End of the line. Thank you very much, and please wait.
[Philip accuses Alex of only using Corinne and tells her]
Corinne, he's got you figured out. All he wants is your money.
You're wrong. He wants my body.
[Philip stares down Alex]
[Corrine talks about the psychiatric term to her condition over her late husband]

My psychiatrist says I suffer from the halo effect, the tendency of widows to idealize their dead husbands. He says it keeps me from falling in love again. He has a point, but I can't imagine I'll ever stop loving Louie.
[Corinne tells her psychiatrist Dr. Bailey, about meeting Alex]
Dr. Bailey. I came here to tell you... That I'm interested in someone. A man. Well, he's almost a man.
What do you mean?
He's 22 years old. But it's not like I'm rushing into anything, I've known him for 26 years.
Corinne.
It's a little complicated.
[as Dr. Bailey notices Corinne is wearing opposite colored shoes, when Corinne tries to cover one shoe with the other]
[Philip finally tells Corinne that he's in love with her]
I'm finding out once and for all what it feels like to hold the woman I love. I've always loved and will always love 'till the day I die.

[Philip kisses Corinne on the lips]
I love you, Corinne.
Why didn't you ever tell me?
How could I?
All these years...
Louie was always there with us, every moment. In your heart. In my heart. In the air.
But I don't feel him here now.
[the woman in the bookstore asks Alex who he was before]
Who were you?
Oh, me? I was no one special.
Oh, we're all special!
I mean, I wasn't Cleopatra or Hannibal or someone great or famous.

[the woman chuckles]
I know you weren't Cleopatra. I was.
[Alex and Philip get in a fight on the floor about not believing Alex is Louie]

[Alex defensively yells]
I'm Louie!
Yeah, and I'm Cleopatra!

[Philip wrestles Alex down]
You are not!
You fight like her though!
[Corrine's boss tells her that she needs to win-over the liking of Mavis Talmadge]
No one in Washington is as rich as Mavis. She's her own corporation. Her own, uh, land mass.
[first lines]

[Philip the best friend and best man, tells Louie the groom, he's in love with Corinne the soon-to-be married bride]
Louie. There's something I have to tell you.

[as Corinne walks up the aisle in her wedding dress]
Now?
I'm in love with Corinne.

[Louie smiles not taking his eyes off Corinne]
I know.
[Louie walks into the backyard of his home, seeing Corinne plant the new tree seedling with Philip]
Philip, I think we'll call the tree George.
[Louie talks to the Limbdrome Staff Member Omar, who asks if he wants to be a boy or a girl]
Boy or a girl?
What's that?
You want to be reborn a boy or a girl?
No, I don't want to be reborn at all. I want to go home right now, just as I am.
Well, that's impossible. You're between bodies right now. Look, you're a soul, a spirit. The only way to get back is to be reborn. Any problem with that?

[sarcastically agrees]
I guess not.
[Miranda has an argument with the librarian, Mrs. Handy, as Alex Finch comes in and takes over for her]
God, is she always that awful?

[Alex makes a disgusted look to her crude remark]
Mom? No.
Uh. I'm sorry.
[Alex Finch gets on the library computer to correct the problem of Miranda's unpaid books]
This is bad.
How bad?
Worse than I thought.
How worse?
A lot. According to this, these books weren't legally checked out.

[Miranda nervously replies]
Yeah. So?

[Alex aggressively replies back]
Yeah! So it means that I can't charge you for them! You beat the system.
[Miranda realizes Alex corrected the problem of her unpaid books by doing her a kindness, Miranda blushes as Alex smiles]
[Corinne tells her psychiatrist, Dr. Bailey, how she's been feeling about Louie]
How have you been feeling?
Fantastic. It was Louie's birthday on Saturday. I baked him a cake with little cherries on it.
I thought we agreed that you were going to stop cooking for him.
It was his birthday. It makes me happy to feed him. The Egyptians fed their dead.
Not after 23 years.
[Alex drives home Philip to Corinne's house]

[Philip looks around the mess throughout Alex's front seat]
What are you doing for dinner?
Dinner? Uh...

[Alex opens his glove compartment revealing a couple oranges and a newspaper]
You're coming with me. My friends live just down the street.
[Alex comes out of the bathroom, remembering that he was Louie in a previous life]
Philip, it's great to see you again.

[Alex wraps a tight hug around Philip]
It's great to see you.

[Alex and Philip turn to see both Miranda and Corinne staring them down, as Alex gets terrified again to have to run back into the bathroom]
Excuse me.
[Alex runs back into the bathroom slamming the door shut]
[Alex and Miranda sit on the guest room bed beside each other]
Have you had a happy life?

[Miranda chuckles]
Yeah, I guess so.
Is there anything you've wanted that you haven't had?
My father.
He was a pretty great guy, huh?
That's what they tell me.
God, you sure have grown up nicely.
I'm glad you approve.

[Miranda leans forward to kiss Alex on the lips, as Alex holds her off]
Good night.
[Alex tries to tell Corinne that he's Louie]
I'm not going to beat around the bush. You won't believe me, but there's something you should know.
All right.

[Alex holds back from telling Corinne the truth, yelling]
Our rain forests are being destroyed at a rate of 50 acres a minute!
[Alex meets the woman in the bookstore after some books fall]
This your first time as a human?
What?

[the woman takes a guess as to what Alex was in a previous life]
I'm getting a strong German Shepherd vibration.
Uh. I used to be a lawyer.

[the woman frowns]
Oh. Close.
[the woman in the bookstore explains to Alex about our past lives]

We're all connected. It's all connected under the skin. You never know who's lurking in what body. Your wife could be your Grandmother. You meet some guy who gets on your nerves, probably your Mother-in-Law. We keep meeting the souls we're attached to. For better or worse, life after life. Sometimes I wonder why I worry about past lives at all. I'm having so much trouble with this one. When you remember your past lives, it's like, your emotions get spread like a dangling nerve all over the map. It makes it very hard to live.
[Corinne asks Philip if he believes someone like Louie could come back to life]

Corinne... I can understand how a person's desires might lead her to believe that. It would be a dream come true. But the last guy to come back, that I know about, was Jesus Christ. You'll see Louie someday.
I know, in Heaven.
[Corinne kisses Philip on the cheek]
[Miranda gets Alex to dance with her at the museum party]

[Miranda begins dancing rather close]
Where did you learn to dance like that?
I inherited it from my father.
[Alex nervously grunts continuing to dance]
[Alex and Corinne have a pillow fight as she denies to believe he's the real Louie]
I know everything about you, Corinne. I know that you love peanut butter, and rhubarb, and cats with yellow eyes.
You're a psychic. You're one of Shirley McClaine's kooks! A spook-bender.
You love Johnny Manthis.

[Corinne hits Alex with the pillow]
Get out of here!
You hate flat feet.

[Corinne hits Alex with the pillow again]
Before I scream so loud that everybody in the neighborhood shows up. I'll have you arrested for impersonating a person.
And I know you did the Watusi before Lucy Baines, remember? Remember this?
[Alex kisses Corinne's mouth which gets her mouth to scream while closed, as she moans, the two fall-kissing in her and Louie's bed]
[Corinne and Alex talk about Miranda while out on a date]
What was Miranda like at 10?
At 10? Precocious. Opinionated. Fiercely independent. She got braces then, which she removed with pliers after wearing them for about an hour.

[Alex chuckles]
I remember Philip telling her, 'All great beauties must suffer and sacrifice'
[Alex asks Corinne to have more babies with him]

[Alex holds Corinne in his hands]
I want to have at least... Two more.
Babies?

[Alex nods]
It's not too late is it?
No.

[Alex frowns and smiles]
Can we start tonight?
[Corinne sneaks into Alex's bedroom and into his bed wearing only lingerie, crawling under the sheets, not knowing it's Philip she starts to kiss]
Oh, Louie!
Louie?

[Corinne sits up turning on the bedroom light]
Philip?

[Corinne covers her chest with the blanket sheet]
What are you doing here?
I'm not sure.
Whatever just happened between us was...
A miracle.
We almost... We could've...
We still can.
[the real Alex compliments Corinne on getting married to Philip]
I just want to say congratulations. You and Philip make a great pair.

[Corinne takes Alex by the shoulder]
Thanks Alex. You know. You're the first boyfriend of Miranda's I ever really liked.
